message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.DC

This paper deals with improving the quality of statistical machine translation (SMT) through the use of morphology constraints. This topic falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP), which is typically classified under cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of machine learning techniques to learn morphology constraints from limited parallel data, which could fall under cs.LG (Machine Learning) or cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also involves the use of phrase tables and system combination, which are common techniques in information retrieval (IR) and distributed computing (DC), respectively. Therefore, cs.IR and cs.DC are also possible sub-categories.
